statements: SELECT * FROM employee_satisfaction_survey_data;
SELECT employee_id, satisfaction_score FROM employee_satisfaction_survey_data WHERE satisfaction_score > 8;
SELECT employee_id, satisfaction_score FROM employee_satisfaction_survey_data ORDER BY satisfaction_score DESC;
SELECT * FROM employee_satisfaction_survey_data WHERE employee_id = 123;
SELECT survey_id, benefits_feedback FROM employee_satisfaction_survey_data WHERE benefits_feedback IS NOT NULL;
SELECT survey_id, employee_id, satisfaction_score, benefits_feedback, improvement_suggestions FROM employee_satisfaction_survey_data WHERE satisfaction_score > 3 ORDER BY satisfaction_score DESC
SELECT employee_id, COUNT(survey_id) AS total_surveys FROM employee_satisfaction_survey_data GROUP BY employee_id HAVING COUNT(survey_id) > 2 ORDER BY total_surveys DESC
SELECT survey_id, AVG(satisfaction_score) AS avg_score FROM employee_satisfaction_survey_data GROUP BY survey_id HAVING AVG(satisfaction_score) < 4 ORDER BY avg_score ASC
SELECT * FROM employee_satisfaction_survey_data WHERE benefits_feedback IS NOT NULL AND improvement_suggestions IS NOT NULL ORDER BY survey_id
SELECT employee_id, SUM(satisfaction_score) AS total_score FROM employee_satisfaction_survey_data GROUP BY employee_id HAVING SUM(satisfaction_score) > 10 ORDER BY total_score DESC
SELECT * FROM survey_data;
SELECT emp_id, satisfaction_rating FROM survey_data WHERE satisfaction_rating > 3;
SELECT first_name, last_name, department FROM employee_details;
SELECT * FROM employee_details WHERE age < 30 ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT survey_id, emp_id, satisfaction_rating, work_life_balance_rating FROM survey_data WHERE emp_id = 101;
SELECT * FROM survey_data WHERE satisfaction_rating > 3 ORDER BY emp_id DESC;

SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name, e.salary, s.satisfaction_rating FROM employee_details e JOIN survey_data s ON e.emp_id = s.emp_id WHERE e.department = 'Engineering' AND s.work_life_balance_rating < 4;

SELECT s.survey_id, e.first_name, e.department, s.satisfaction_rating FROM employee_details e JOIN survey_data s ON e.emp_id = s.emp_id WHERE e.age BETWEEN 25 AND 35 AND s.work_life_balance_rating > 3;

SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name, e.department, e.age, e.salary, s.satisfaction_rating, s.work_life_balance_rating FROM employee_details e JOIN survey_data s ON e.emp_id = s.emp_id WHERE e.salary > 50000 AND s.work_life_balance_rating < 3 ORDER BY e.salary DESC;
SELECT AVG(s.satisfaction_rating) AS avg_satisfaction_rating, AVG(e.salary) AS avg_salary FROM survey_data s JOIN employee_details e ON s.emp_id = e.emp_id WHERE e.department = 'Sales';
SELECT * FROM EmployeeData;
SELECT employee_id, full_name, department FROM EmployeeData WHERE department = 'Engineering';
SELECT * FROM SurveyResponses WHERE q1_rating > 3;
SELECT employee_id, full_name, hire_date FROM EmployeeData ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT package_name, health_insurance, retirement_plan FROM BenefitPackages WHERE vacation_days > 20;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeData WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT employee_id, full_name, department FROM EmployeeData WHERE hire_date >= '2021-01-01';
SELECT e.full_name, e.department, b.package_name FROM EmployeeData e INNER JOIN BenefitPackages b ON e.department = b.health_insurance;
SELECT employee_id, hire_date, q1_rating, q2_rating, q3_rating FROM EmployeeData E JOIN SurveyResponses S ON E.employee_id = S.employee_id;
SELECT e.full_name, e.job_title, b.retirement_plan FROM EmployeeData e INNER JOIN BenefitPackages b ON e.department = b.package_name;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_id, name, department FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000;
SELECT department, name, salary FROM employees ORDER BY department ASC, salary DESC;
SELECT * FROM surveys WHERE type='Employee Satisfaction' AND date > '2021-01-01';
SELECT benefit_name, description, cost FROM benefits WHERE cost < 1000 ORDER BY cost ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR' ORDER BY salary DESC
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000
SELECT * FROM surveys WHERE type = 'Employee Satisfaction' AND date > '2021-01-01'
SELECT e.name, s.question FROM employees e JOIN responses r ON e.employee_id = r.employee_id JOIN surveys s ON r.survey_id = s.survey_id
SELECT COUNT(*) AS num_benefits FROM benefits
SELECT * FROM employees
SELECT employee_name, department, hire_date FROM employees
SELECT survey_id, survey_date, survey_type FROM surveys
SELECT response_id, survey_id, employee_id, response_text FROM responses
SELECT benefit_name, benefit_type, benefit_description FROM benefits
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR' ORDER BY employee_name DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT employee_name, department FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000 ORDER BY salary DESC
SELECT employee_id, hire_date, salary FROM employees WHERE salary BETWEEN 40000 AND 60000 AND hire_date > '2020-01-01'

SELECT e.employee_name, s.survey_type, r.rating_score FROM employees e JOIN responses res ON e.employee_id = res.employee_id JOIN surveys s ON res.survey_id = s.survey_id JOIN ratings r ON e.employee_id = r.employee_id WHERE r.rating_score > 3 ORDER BY e.employee_name ASC, s.survey_date DESC

SELECT b.benefit_name, b.benefit_type, COUNT(r.rating_id) AS total_ratings FROM benefits b LEFT JOIN ratings r ON b.benefit_id = r.benefit_id GROUP BY b.benefit_name, b.benefit_type ORDER BY total_ratings DESC
